title: Latest updates: East Midlands Live on Wednesday 2 August 2017 - BBC News
summary: bird of prey left cuts on jogger 's head .
stolen jcb used in botched cash machine raid .
s 'zombies ' putting pressure on ambulance service .

documents.title: leics v notts abandoned due to rain
text: leics v notts abandoned due to rain

documents.title: 'can we have our ball back ? ' - wessels hits six out of ground
text: 'can we have our ball back ? ' - wessels hits six out of ground

documents.title: injured man charged with murder
text: injured man charged with murder

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: dedicated live coverage has now ended , but some news , sport and travel updates will continue to appear through the night .
east midlands live returns from 08:00 tomorrow morning .

documents.title: lorries to benefit from £ 6.1m spend
text: a bridge in burton is going to have £ 6.1m spent on it so lorries can keep using it in the future .
the county council says the money is from the government and will be used on st peter 's bridge .
they say the work will include replacing bearings and aims to prevent any future unplanned maintenance work .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: east midlands weather update : a dry and clear evening ahead
text: the rain will clear away this evening and cloud will gradually start to break up to leave some clear spells .
showers will feed in from the west during the early hours with minimum temperatures of 14c ( 57f ) .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: film crew seeking extras for cbbc show jamie johnson
text: filming for the hit cbbc show jamie johnson has begun at a secret location in nottingham .
the show - which is focused on jamie , who is a football mad , hot-headed teenager - is returning to our screens for a third series .
there will be an exciting opportunity for people to star in a football scene for one of the episodes .
author: Hayley Compton
Reporter, BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: 'overheating ' homes warning by university
text: researchers from the university of loughborough have warned there 's a growing risk of modern homes becoming unhealthily warm during the summer months .
experts involved in a new study say the problem is a result of climate change and newer , better insulated homes .
professor kevin lomas , from the university , told the bbc : `` uk homes are increasingly tending to overheat in the summertime .

`` we definitely need to continue to insulate our homes to keep people warm and healthy in the winter but we also have to think about what we need to do in the summer - now that our climate is warming - to make sure people are protected from ill health . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: woman , 21 , remanded after child abduction and grooming charges
text: a 21-year-old woman has been remanded in custody after being charged with child abduction and grooming .
she was charged with child abduction , arranging to meet a child for sex following grooming and two breaches of a sexual harm prevention order , nottinghamshire police said .
the woman appeared at nottingham magistrates ' court today and is due to appear at nottingham crown court via video link on 30 august .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: bird of prey left cuts on jogger 's head
text: bird of prey left cuts on jogger 's head

documents.title: watch : air raid shelter is mystery to residents
text: we were recently asked via your questions about the big air raid shelter at abbey circus in west bridgford .
you certainly ca n't miss it - but do people living nearby even realise what it is ?
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: missing nottingham teenager found
text: police who were searching for missing teenager cameron burton say he has been found .
cameron went missing from rise park on monday .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: armed police to patrol leicester 's caribbean carnival
text: armed officers are to be deployed at this weekend 's caribbean carnival in leicester , police have said .
the force has been using visibly armed officers at major events on a more regular basis over the past few months in response to terror attacks earlier this year .
armed police patrolled alongside their unarmed colleagues at download festival as well as at the little mix concert at donington park .
the carnival , which has been running for more than 30 years , will feature a parade through the city and a party at victoria park .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: forest pair to miss start of season
text: forest pair to miss start of season

documents.title: england wing may set for tigers move
text: england wing may set for tigers move

documents.title: watch : peaty says best is yet to come
text: he might have up three medals and broken numerous records at the world championships in budapest , but city of derby swimmer adam peaty insists his best is yet to come .
he told bbc sport : `` i do n't think i 've even started to hit my peak yet .
i need that man strength to come through now - i 'm still on boy strength ! ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : muddy conditions at bakewell show
text: this video gives an idea of the muddy conditions that have caused delays for people arriving at the bakewell show today and led to some vehicles getting stuck in the mud .
event organisers say they 've ordered some tracks which should make it easier for visitors arriving by car tomorrow .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: masked raiders try to take cash machine
text: masked raiders try to take cash machine

documents.title: your photos : tur langton rainbow
text: this photo of a rainbow - taken by weather watcher michael in tur langton - was so nice we 've just posted it on bbc leicester 's instagram account .
the only thing that could improve it would be an appearance by zippy , george and bungle .
author: Instagram

documents.title: burglar targets 86-year-old man twice in same night
text: an 86-year-old man was burgled twice in the same night by the same person , police have said .
the pensioner discovered the burglar in the bathroom of his home in weston park avenue , shelton lock , at about 01:00 on 26 july and pushed him out of the house .
the man told police he woke to find the same burglar in his bedroom at 03:45 , who then fled through a kitchen window .
police said a piece of jewellery is believed to have been stolen during the first burglary and cash was taken during the second .
pc nikita devney said : the victim in this case showed great bravery in the face of quite an ordeal .
we are anxious to arrest the offender to provide reassurance and prevent others from suffering at his hands . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: two arrested after 'racially aggravated assault '
text: two men have been arrested after reports of a fight in arnold .
nottinghamshire police said they were called to front street at about 13:50 bst following reports of two men fighting .
a 29-year-old man has been detained on sus of a racially aggravated assault , while a 59-year-old man has been arrested on sus of affray .
front street was closed off briefly while officers dealt with the situation but has now reopened .
no further details about the incident have been released .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: sport gossip : mahrez moves closer to exit
text: leicester city get not one , not two , but three mentions in today 's bbc sport football gossip column .
the papers have riyad mahrez moving closer to the exit door , and also say the foxes are edging nearer to the signing of manchester city striker kelechi iheanacho .
there 's also a bit about derby county 's interest in tom lawrence .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: christmas dinner woman now offers meals weekly
text: a community worker - who made headlines in december when she invited more than 100 people for christmas dinner - has turned her charitable act into a weekly event .
mo fayose , from nottingham , invited anyone to her house on christmas day but had to hire two venues due to the demand .
the mental health student nurse now offers a three-course weekly meal for 12 people on wednesday evenings .
the mother-of-two said : `` the whole point is to bring people together who are on their own and to have a proper meal .
`` last week we had salmon and a lady said , 'i have never had it in my life ' , and she is close to 70 - that really broke my heart .
`` that is the whole point of this , to make new friends , eat proper food and have fun . ''
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: car park problems at bakewell show
text: events are in full swing inside the showground , it 's the main car park off site that 's causing long delays .
cars ca n't get on or off .
author: Heidi Booth
Journalist, BBC Radio Derby

documents.title: van gets stuck in mud at bakewell show
text: oh dear it seems a bbc van has got into a sticky mess at the bakewell show this afternoon .
the main car park was closed briefly , while the site was assessed following heavy rainfall , causing major delays .
flooding also closed the main road on to the site .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tigers visit hampson 's get busy living centre
text: tigers visit hampson 's get busy living centre

documents.title: boy , 17 , missing from nottingham
text: officers are concerned for teenager cameron burton who has been reported missing from rise park .
the 17-year-old was last seen at about 13:30 on monday , nottinghamshire police said .
cameron was last seen wearing a multi-coloured tye-dye hooded top , black jeans , black and white knee high boots and was carrying a green and black rucksack .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: horse events cancelled at mud-hit bakewell show
text: long delays and traffic problems are being reported on the first day of the bakewell show .
several of today 's equestrian events have been cancelled because the ground is so saturated .
organisers say they 've been doing everything they can to ease the mud from getting tankers in to suction off excess water and laying down straw .
author: Aleena Naylor
BBC Radio Derby newsreader

documents.title: stolen jcb used in botched cash machine raid
text: police say a jcb digger used in a botched cash machine burglary in staffordshire is believed to have been stolen from a farm in netherseal .

a group of masked raiders tried to use the digger to remove a cash machine from the wall of a co-op store in kings bromley at about 03:10 but fled the scene in cars when they were disturbed by police .
structural engineers are now examining the damage to the shop and police have appealed for witnesses .

documents.title: traffic and travel : train delays possible
text: services are being disrupted through lincolnshire :
# vtecupdate due to minor damage to the overhead electric wires between # grantham and # newark trains through these stations may be delayed .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: leicestershire cemeteries 'running out of space '
text: there 's concern that cemeteries across leicestershire are starting to run out of space .
loughborough cemetery is expected to be full in five to seven years and charnwood borough council says its investigating its options .
the institute of cemetery and crematorium management has suggested the only way forward is to reuse graves after 75 years .
author: East Midlands Today

documents.title: your comments : price rise for wollaton hall car park
text: many of you have got in touch on facebook to share thoughts on the 50 % price hike for parking at wollaton hall .
sarah ramowski said : `` i think you should be able to park for free for an hour and after 6pm .
if you would like to regularly walk your dog or bring the children to the play area then £ 3 every time is a lot to pay .
i think if you intend to visit the park for the day then the charges are fair . ''
neil asher posted : `` if i 'm gon na spend all day walking round the park then spending an extra couple of minutes parking outside it ai n't going to be a problem to me .
many people already do this to avoid the ( lower ) parking charges at the excellent bradgate park in newton linford , leics . ''
ray bradshaw said : `` seems good value to me for what you get . ''
roger bailey said : `` that 's another one crossed of my days out list . ''
author: Facebook

documents.title: nottingham the 'third most affordable city ' for first-time buyers
text: buying your first home can be a daunting experience but it has been revealed nottingham is one of the most affordable cities for first-time buyers .
research by the post office says the average property price for the county is £ 128,192 and 89 % of these are affordable to people buying for the first time .
southampton is the most affordable city with norwich second .
the worst location for first-time buyers is brighton with just 2 % of properties affordable to house-hunters wanting to get onto the property ladder .
the affordibility study calculated the proportion of homes available for less than 4.5 times the average income of first-time buyers .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: jogger attack : angry bird 'most likely a buzzard '
text: we 've had plenty of comments on facebook about our story of a jogger being attacked by a bird in chellaston .
shaun walters posted : `` i 've read about this happening before , most likely to be a buzzard protecting it 's young that must have been close by . ''
malcolm hall bluntly posted : `` because his head looks like an egg . ''
author: Facebook

documents.title: bakewell show 'going well '
text: bakewell show organisers are in a positive mood , despite the muddy conditions .
however , some are still complaining of delays on the a6 approach to the showground .
bakewell show organiser janet bailey `` everything going well and people happy now and loads to see and do now ''
3 hours stuck in traffic then the mud in the `` car park '' no management to speak to , only the rent a security
head in clouds ms bailey !
stuck in traffic for 3 1/2 hours with no info from you .
gave up , and got home in 25 mins .
organisation ?
rubbish !
really ?
i queued for 2 hours to go less than 2 miles and did n't make it to the car park
traffic management poor !
traffic q v slow what 's the delay
we 've turned round after queuing for an hour in rain and getting no where near entrance ! !
no marshalls in sight !
been stuck in a queue for 1.5 hrs .
turned round and gave up .
traffic all the way up the hill about 2 miles .
hope she 's not planning on driving anywhere soon .
not to run the park & ride this year was a stupid , stupid decision .
im still queuing in traffic ; (
that 's not quite true .
still stuck in traffic since 8:30 !
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: brewers to finish rock-bottom , journalists predict
text: let 's hope for burton albion 's sake , bbc sport 's predicted championship table for the 2017/18 season turns out to be wrong .
the brewers are most likely to finish bottom , according to the collated result from a group of 25 bbc sport journalists .
they 've placed the rams in the play-off positions but are forecasting mid-table mediocrity for nottingham forest .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: the story of knights templars revealed at newark castle
text: volunteers travelled back in time to explore the links between newark castle and the knights templar .
an exhibition at the castle tells the story of the knights templars who were imprisoned there in the early 1300s .
the knights templars ' prayer niches can still be seen in a dungeon and there are examples of templar graffiti scattered around the castle .

wayne crawford , who helped create the exhibition , said : when most people think about newark castle they think about king john , who died there is 1216 , of the english civil wars and the sieges of newark but this exhibition uncovers an untold story of the castle . ''
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : council exploring victoria park safety options
text: leicester city council is reviewing safety at victoria park after a woman was left critically injured in an assault last month .
proposals include lifting branches on the trees and installing more cctv - as well as exploring ways to encourage more people to walk through the park .
city councillor patrick kitterick said : `` we 've got to recognise that people use this path and try to make it as open as possible .
`` the thing that 'll make most people feel safe is if we populate it with lots of people . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: missing teenager found safe and well
text: police say 15-year-old tegan budd , who was reported missing from her home in earl shilton on monday , was found safe and well in leicester this morning .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'hero ' biker grateful for wheelchair donation
text: a man who was left paralysed when he crashed into a ditch after steering away from a group of cyclists says he 's been `` overwhelmed '' by a donation towards his rehabilitation .
chris toon , 32 , from derbyshire , broke his back and will never walk again after the crash on his motorbike near melton mowbray in june .
mr toon said it had given him a `` boost '' after about £ 17,000 was raised to help pay for a special wheelchair .
author: Neil Heath
BBC News Online

documents.title: listen : jogger on vicious 'bird attack '
text: andy llewellyn has been speaking to bbc radio derby about the moment a bird swooped down and slashed his head while he was jogging in chellaston .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: men deny mosque hate crime
text: two men have denied racially aggravated offences outside a mosque .
the men , aged 27 and 30 , appeared at nottingham magistrates ' court yesterday charged with racially aggravated harassment offences .
the 27-year-old was also charged with criminal damage to al-quba masjid mosque at the fiveways multi-faith centre in sherwood .
both entered not guilty pleas and were released on conditional bail to return to court on 10 october .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: firefighters tackle former pub blaze
text: fire crews tackled a blaze at a derelict former pub in bakersfield , nottingham last night .
the fire broke out on the ground floor of the two-storey building at the former greenwood tree pub in greenwood road , nottinghamshire fire and rescue service said .
the cause of the fire has not been revealed .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: major delays for bakewell show visitors
text: visitors to the bakewell show are being asked to remain patient after queues of up to an hour built up along the a6 this morning .
organisers say they closed the main car park for a brief period while they assessed the site following heavy rainfall .
they 've deemed the ground still suitable for cars to park on and say any backlog should be cleared shortly .
a major operation has been taking place over the past few days to improve conditions at bakewell showground following heavy rain .
author: Aleena Naylor
BBC Radio Derby newsreader

documents.title: rams keen on foxes star
text: derby county want leicester city 's young star tom lawrence but his manager at the king power says he 'd like lawrence to stay with the foxes .
derby had a £ 7m bid rejected yesterday for the 23-year-old welsh international who caught the eye last season when he scored 11 goals on loan at ipswich .
author: Owen Bradley
BBC Radio Derby Sport

documents.title: predict your final championship table
text: predict your final championship table

documents.title: jogger 's head slashed in derby 'bird attack '
text: a jogger has been showing off the horrendous injuries he suffered in what he thinks was a bird attack .
andy llewellyn said he was running near the medical centre in chellaston when he was targeted by what he believes may have been a bird of prey .
he said : `` all of a sudden i felt this almighty slap on the back of my head , put my hand up and there was lots of blood on my head .
i think i was attacked by a bird of prey .
`` i went to the walk-in centre and they said they 'd never seen anything like it .
they cleaned it up and gave me some antibiotics .
`` i did n't actually see it but i heard the flapping of wings as it hit my head .
i was a bit in shock and a bit dazed .
`` ironically after the attack , i did make my fastest time . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: city library shake-up to go ahead after challenge fails
text: the conservative opposition at derby city council has failed in a bid to derail the labour-led authority 's plans to hand ten of the city 's 15 libraries to volunteers .

the council confirmed the move last month but the conservatives used a procedure reserved for `` exceptional circumstances '' to call for the plan to be halted , claiming the decision was not made properly or within the rules .
a council hearing last night rejected that argument - with the labour majority backing their administration 's plan .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: charity giving underwear to refugees
text: this small nottingham project has been giving underwear to people in refugee camps .
it 's so successful , caroline kerr has opened up a shop
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'hero ' biker overwhelmed by donations
text: 'hero ' biker overwhelmed by donations

documents.title: hospital issues 55 parking penalties in first day of scheme
text: there were 55 penalty notices handed out on the first day of a clamp down on parking at nottingham hospitals .
a £ 50 parking charge came into force yesterday if drivers parked dangerously or inconsiderately at the qmc or nottingham city hospital .
this means drivers ca n't park on grass verges , in a disabled space without a valid blue badge or anywhere that is reserved for emergency vehicles .
nottingham university hospitals trust said the scheme has so far been a success and routes for emergency vehicles were clearer .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: victoria park safety reviewed after attack on woman
text: security is being reviewed at leicester 's victoria park after a woman was badly injured in an attack last month .
a woman was critically injured when she was dragged into bushes and assaulted on 3 july .
she 's now in a stable condition and a 17-year-old boy has been charged with attempted murder , robbery and two counts of rape .

leicester city council said safety had been improved over the past few years but it was now looking at whether any further improvements could be made including cutting back trees and installing cctv .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: price rise for wollaton hall car park
text: the summer holidays are in full swing and many families will be heading for days out .
but those visiting wollaton hall in nottingham should be aware of the 50 % increase in parking charges .
it is now £ 3 for three hours and £ 5 for the whole day to park in it 's car park .
nottingham city council says the revenue is necessary to maintain the historic park , improve play areas and manage the famous deer .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: s 'zombies ' put ambulance service under pressure
text: the ambulance service says the use of formerly legal highs like s and black mamba is putting huge pressure on its staff .
the drugs can induce a zombie-like state in users and east midlands ambulance service said a spike at the weekend saw 31 call-outs in 48 hours - with three incidents of staff being assaulted .
rowan hussain , who was on duty for the service at the weekend , said she and her colleagues were duty bound to help .
`` it just complicates the dealing with the patient .
the patient 's not compliant and a lot of the time they do n't want us to help them , '' she said .
`` they either get up and walk away or lash out at staff members so to actually try to treat them is very difficult as you ca n't really get near to them . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : wednesday 's weather for the east midlands
text: here 's how today is looking
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: travel : updates from across the region
text: travel : updates from across the region
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: join us for our live coverage
text: good morning nottinghamshire , derbyshire and leicestershire .
gavin bevis and i will be writing the updates on today 's live page with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel .
if you 'd like to get in touch with us , you can send an email , or use facebook or twitter .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live
